name: SYRIAN AMERICAN MEDICAL SOCIETY FOUNDATION
mission: SAMS works to serve the medical needs of patients in need, regardless of religious background, race, ethnicity, or political affiliation.
zakatClaimEvidence: SAMS is Zakat-eligible. You can fulfill your Zakat by donating through the Ramadan page and designating it toward: Medical treatment. Essential medications. Emergency care. Support for the most vulnerable families. (Source: https://sams-usa.net/donate/)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Good donor alignment with manageable risk. Evidence quality is solid but still evolving in places.

components.evidence: Accepts zakat (+2); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Asnaf: fuqara (+5); Operates in Muslim-majority regions (+3); Strong humanitarian service (+4)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.improvement_suggestion: Expand services to underserved populations or geographies with limited nonprofit coverage.
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 41/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, global health cause area

components.evidence: No beneficiary data available for cost-per-beneficiary scoring; high program ratio (≥85%) suggests efficient delivery
components.improvement_suggestion: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so cost-effectiveness can be assessed.
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

components.improvement_suggestion: Document a clear theory of change with an explicit causal pathway.
components.name: Theory of Change

score_details.score_summary: SYRIAN AMERICAN MEDICAL SOCIETY FOUNDATION shows strong alignment and strong impact, with zakat compliance (minor risk deductions applied).

zakat.claim_evidence: SAMS is Zakat-eligible. You can fulfill your Zakat by donating through the Ramadan page and designating it toward: Medical treatment. Essential medications. Emergency care. Support for the most vulnerable families. (Source: https://sams-usa.net/donate/)

all_citations.claim: The organization reported a total revenue of $99,929,862 and maintains a 95.6% program expense ratio.
Financial data confirms total revenue of $99,929,862 and a fundraising efficiency of $0.01 per $1 raised.
SAMS provides medical services and therapy that result in a reduction of PTSD symptoms.
The organization operates medical services inside Syria to combat the effects of conflict on mental health.
all_citations.source_name: Human Devastation Syndrome: The Impact of Conflict on Mental Health

all_citations.claim: SAMS facilitates support groups for children in Jordan and Syria as part of its medical service provision.
The organization is zakat-eligible and offers various giving methods for donors.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: SAMS demonstrates high financial efficiency and a strong commitment to direct service delivery in high-urgency conflict zones. The organization maintains a high level of transparency and is recognized as zakat-eligible for Muslim donors.
areas_for_improvement: Expanding third-party impact verification to further validate long-term health outcomes.
Increasing public disclosure of specific cost-per-beneficiary metrics across diverse program types.

dimension_explanations.alignment: The organization shows high alignment for donors interested in global health and humanitarian relief, particularly within the context of the Syrian crisis [3]. It is confirmed as zakat-eligible, providing a high degree of fit for Muslim donors seeking to fulfill religious charitable obligations through established medical programs [6].
dimension_explanations.impact: SAMS achieves a high impact through direct service delivery, providing critical medical services inside Syria and neighboring countries to address 'Human Devastation Syndrome' [4][5]. The foundation maintains a 95.6% program expense ratio, reflecting a deep commitment to utilizing resources for patient care and medical education [1][2].

baseline_narrative.headline: The Syrian American Medical Society Foundation provides life-saving medical relief and humanitarian aid to vulnerable populations regardless of their background or affiliation.
strengths: Exceptional program expense ratio of 95.6%, ensuring the vast majority of funds reach those in need.
Highly efficient fundraising operations with a cost of only $0.01 per $1 raised.
Strong liquidity with 4.6 months of working capital available for operations.
baseline_narrative.summary: The Syrian American Medical Society (SAMS) Foundation is a non-political medical relief organization that operates primary and specialty healthcare centers, emergency response initiatives, and medical education programs [3][4]. In the most recent fiscal year, the organization reported a total revenue of $99,929,862 to support its mission of serving patients in need [1][2].

all_citations.claim: Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid

all_citations.quote: Geographic Coverage: Syria, Jordan, Lebanon, Turkey, Egypt, Iraq, Gaza, Libya, Ukraine, Morocco
Working Capital: 4.6 months of working capital
Reduction in PTSD symptoms after therapy: Significant improvement
Improvement: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so cost-effectiveness can be assessed.
Improvement: Document a clear theory of change with an explicit causal pathway.

all_citations.quote: Improvement: Expand services to underserved populations or geographies with limited nonprofit coverage.

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: SAMS demonstrates high financial efficiency and a strong commitment to direct service delivery in high-urgency conflict zones. The organization maintains a high level of transparency and is recognized as zakat-eligible for Muslim donors.

areas_for_improvement.detail: While total service counts are high, the organization should <cite id="15">publish consistent beneficiary counts</cite> to allow for standardized cost-effectiveness analysis.
The organization currently lacks a <cite id="16">documented theory of change</cite> with explicit causal pathways for its long-term health interventions.

bbb_assessment.summary: Maintains high governance standards with 100% independent board and audited financials.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization's high program ratio and verified service counts mitigate concerns regarding operational efficiency.
risk_factors: <cite id="16">No explicit causal pathway documented</cite> in a formal theory of change
case_against.summary: The primary limitation is a <cite id="15">lack of standardized cost-per-beneficiary metrics</cite> and a formal theory of change.

confidence.data_freshness: Financial data from 2023 Form 990; Impact data from 2018 mental health report
data_gaps: No formal theory of change document
confidence.notes: Strong financial and governance data; impact data is verified but could be more current.

known_gaps: No formal theory of change document

alignment.explanation: SAMS is a premier fit for Muslim donors, as it <cite id="9">accepts zakat</cite> and serves <cite id="10">fuqara and masakin</cite> in Muslim-majority crisis zones.
alignment.improvement: The organization could further improve alignment by <cite id="17">expanding services to additional underserved geographies</cite> with limited nonprofit coverage.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust SAMS due to its <cite id="5">Platinum Seal of Transparency</cite> and <cite id="14">100% independent board</cite>. The organization has a <cite id="1">28-year track record</cite> of specialized medical delivery.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility, SAMS could <cite id="16">document a clear theory of change</cite> to better communicate its long-term strategic impact.

impact.explanation: Operations are highly direct, with <cite id="4">3.5 million services provided</cite> and a <cite id="13">95.6% program expense ratio</cite>.
impact.improvement: Impact measurement would benefit from <cite id="15">publishing consistent beneficiary counts</cite> to assess cost-effectiveness across different regions.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade B - Verified outcomes and service tracking

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Direct implementation through SAMS-run facilities and medical missions

rich_narrative.headline: The Syrian American Medical Society Foundation provides life-saving medical relief and humanitarian aid to vulnerable populations regardless of their background or affiliation.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to provide direct, life-saving medical interventions in active conflict zones through a zakat-eligible, highly efficient organization.
donor_motivations: Want to fulfill zakat obligations by supporting healthcare for the needy
Prioritize low fundraising overhead to ensure funds reach the field
Value specialized medical expertise in humanitarian response
Seek to support established organizations with deep roots in the Syrian crisis
giving_considerations: High growth rate suggests the organization can effectively absorb large gifts
Focus is on high-intensity conflict zones with inherent operational risks
Direct service model requires ongoing funding for medical staff and supplies
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking long-term economic development programs or those who require rigorous RCT-level evidence for every intervention.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade B reflects <cite id="12">verified outcome tracking</cite> for mental health and high-volume service delivery data, though a formal theory of change is missing.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: SAMS operates on the logic that providing direct medical care and training local healthcare workers in crisis zones reduces mortality and improves long-term mental health outcomes.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that medical interventions actually lead to improved patient health and recovery in unstable environments.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: The massive scale of medical needs in Syria and Gaza, combined with a <cite id="3">54.2% revenue growth rate</cite>, indicates high capacity to absorb new funds.

organizational_capacity.geographic_reach: Syria, Jordan, Lebanon, Turkey, Egypt, Iraq, Gaza, Libya, Ukraine, Morocco

peer_comparison.differentiator: Distinguished by an <cite id="8">extremely low fundraising cost of $0.01 per $1 raised</cite> compared to the peer median.

similar_organizations.differentiator: Similar focus on healthcare and humanitarian relief

similar_organizations.differentiator: Direct medical service in similar conflict zones

strengths.detail: The organization spends only <cite id="8">$0.01 to raise every $1</cite> in contribution revenue, which is significantly better than industry averages.
SAMS maintains <cite id="11">4.6 months of working capital</cite>, providing a strong buffer to continue medical operations during funding fluctuations.
The foundation has documented <cite id="12">significant improvements in PTSD symptoms</cite> through its mental health programs and support groups for children.

strengths_deep_dive: SAMS Foundation demonstrates a high degree of operational excellence through its direct service delivery model. By managing its own medical facilities and missions, the organization maintains a <cite id="13">program expense ratio of 95.6%</cite>, which aligns with industry standards for global health. Their governance is supported by an <cite id="14">independent board of 8 members</cite>, ensuring oversight and accountability. Furthermore, their ability to scale is evidenced by the <cite id="3">54.2% revenue CAGR</cite>, allowing them to respond to emerging crises in Ukraine and Gaza while maintaining their core commitment to Syrian refugees.
rich_narrative.summary: The Syrian American Medical Society (SAMS) Foundation is a non-political medical relief organization that has been <cite id="1">operating since 1998</cite> to provide life-saving healthcare to vulnerable populations. SAMS specializes in emergency response, medical education, and specialized healthcare delivery, particularly in conflict zones. In the 2023 fiscal year, the organization reported <cite id="2">total revenue of $99,929,862</cite>, representing a significant <cite id="3">three-year revenue growth rate of 54.2%</cite>. This financial expansion supports a massive operational footprint that has delivered <cite id="4">over 3.5 million medical services</cite> to those in need. The organization maintains a high level of transparency, holding a <cite id="5">Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite>. While its primary focus remains the Syrian crisis, where it has provided <cite id="6">3.2 million medical services inside Syria</cite>, SAMS has expanded its reach to include <cite id="7">Gaza, Ukraine, Lebanon, and Turkey</cite>. The foundation operates with extreme efficiency, maintaining a <cite id="8">fundraising efficiency of $0.01 per $1 raised</cite>, ensuring that donor contributions are almost entirely directed toward medical supplies, personnel, and facility operations. As a <cite id="9">zakat-eligible organization</cite>, SAMS provides a critical channel for Muslim donors to support healthcare infrastructure for the <cite id="10">poor (fuqara) and needy (masakin)</cite> in some of the world's most underserved regions.
